intro: Ceropegia nampyana, commonly known as the Nampya milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright light. Ceropegia nampyana is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
